"**Can 't Help Falling in Love**" is a [pop](/wiki/Pop_music "Pop music")
ballad originally recorded by American singer [Elvis
Presley](/wiki/Elvis_Presley "Elvis Presley") and published by Gladys Music,
Elvis Presley's [publishing company](/wiki/Music_publisher_\(popular_music\)
"Music publisher \(popular music\)"). It was written by [Hugo
Peretti](/wiki/Hugo_Peretti "Hugo Peretti"), [Luigi
Creatore](/wiki/Luigi_Creatore "Luigi Creatore") and [George David
Weiss](/wiki/George_David_Weiss "George David Weiss").[2] The melody is based
on "[Plaisir d'amour](/wiki/Plaisir_d%27amour "Plaisir d'amour")"[4] (1784), a
popular romance by [Jean-Paul-Égide Martini](/wiki/Jean-
Paul-%C3%89gide_Martini "Jean-Paul-Égide Martini") (1741–1816). It was
featured in [Elvis Presley](/wiki/Elvis_Presley "Elvis Presley")'s 1961 film,
_[Blue Hawaii](/wiki/Blue_Hawaii "Blue Hawaii")_. During the following four
decades, it was recorded by numerous other artists, including Tom Smothers,
British [reggae](/wiki/Reggae "Reggae") group [UB40](/wiki/UB40 "UB40"), whose
1993 version topped the [U.S.](/wiki/Billboard_Hot_100 "Billboard Hot 100")
and [UK](/wiki/UK_Singles_Chart "UK Singles Chart") charts, and Swedish pop
group [A-Teens](/wiki/A-Teens "A-Teens").

## Elvis Presley
version[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Can%27t_Help_Falling_in_Love&action=edit&section=1
"Edit section: Elvis Presley version")]

Elvis Presley's version of the song, which topped the British charts in 1962,
has appeared in numerous other films, including the 2000 film _[Coyote
Ugly](/wiki/Coyote_Ugly_\(film\) "Coyote Ugly \(film\)")_ , the 2002 Disney
film _[Lilo& Stitch](/wiki/Lilo_%26_Stitch "Lilo & Stitch")_, the 2016 film
_[The Conjuring 2](/wiki/The_Conjuring_2 "The Conjuring 2")_ and the pilot
episode of _[Sons of Anarchy](/wiki/Sons_of_Anarchy "Sons of Anarchy")_. Other
films that feature the song include _[Overboard](/wiki/Overboard_\(film\)
"Overboard \(film\)")_ , _[Honeymoon in Vegas](/wiki/Honeymoon_in_Vegas
"Honeymoon in Vegas")_ , _[The Thing Called Love](/wiki/The_Thing_Called_Love
"The Thing Called Love")_ , _Was It Something I Said?_ , _[Fools Rush
In](/wiki/Fools_Rush_In_\(1997_film\) "Fools Rush In \(1997 film\)")_ , _[Love
Stinks](/wiki/Love_Stinks_\(film\) "Love Stinks \(film\)")_ and _[Happily Ever
After](/wiki/Happily_Ever_After_\(2004_film\) "Happily Ever After \(2004
film\)")_. The single is certified by the
[RIAA](/wiki/Recording_Industry_Association_of_America "Recording Industry
Association of America") as a [Platinum](/wiki/RIAA_certification "RIAA
certification") record, for US sales in excess of one million copies. In the
United States, the Elvis Presley version of the song peaked at number two on
the pop chart and went to number one on the [Easy
Listening](/wiki/Hot_adult_contemporary "Hot adult contemporary") chart for
six weeks.[5]

During Presley's late 1960s and 1970s live performances, the song was
performed as the show's finale. Most notably, it was also sung in the live
segment of his 1968 NBC television special, and as the closer for his 1973
Global telecast, _[Aloha from Hawaii](/wiki/Aloha_from_Hawaii_Via_Satellite
"Aloha from Hawaii Via Satellite")_. A version with a faster arrangement was
used as the closing for Presley's final TV special, _[Elvis in
Concert](/wiki/Elvis_in_Concert "Elvis in Concert")._

In 1993, British [reggae](/wiki/Reggae "Reggae") band [UB40](/wiki/UB40
"UB40") recorded the song as the first [single](/wiki/Single_\(music\) "Single
\(music\)") from their 1993 album _[Promises and Lies](/wiki/Promises_and_Lies
"Promises and Lies")_. The song was released in May 1993, in the majority of
countries worldwide. It eventually climbed to number one on the [_Billboard_
Hot 100](/wiki/Billboard_Hot_100 "Billboard Hot 100") after debuting at number
100 and appears in the [soundtrack](/wiki/Sliver_\(soundtrack\) "Sliver
\(soundtrack\)") of the movie _[Sliver](/wiki/Sliver_\(film\) "Sliver
\(film\)")_ ,[6] the trailer for _[Fools Rush
In](/wiki/Fools_Rush_In_\(1997_film\) "Fools Rush In \(1997 film\)")_ and an
episode of _[Hindsight](/wiki/Hindsight_\(TV_series\) "Hindsight \(TV
series\)")_. It remained at number one in the [United
States](/wiki/United_States "United States") for seven weeks. It was also
number one in the [United Kingdom](/wiki/United_Kingdom "United Kingdom"),
[Austria](/wiki/Austria "Austria"), [Netherlands](/wiki/Netherlands
"Netherlands"), [Sweden](/wiki/Sweden "Sweden"), [Australia](/wiki/Australia
"Australia"), and [New Zealand](/wiki/New_Zealand "New Zealand"). The single
version of the song has a slightly different backing rhythm and melody.

In the US, and on the _Sliver_ soundtrack, the song title was listed as "Can't
Help Falling in Love," rather than what appeared on the record sleeve.

The song was the [A-Teens](/wiki/A-Teens "A-Teens")'s first single from their
first [extended play](/wiki/Extended_play "Extended play") _[Pop'til You
Drop!](/wiki/Pop_%27til_You_Drop! "Pop 'til You Drop!")_, as well as for the
_[Lilo& Stitch](/wiki/Lilo_%26_Stitch "Lilo & Stitch")_ movie soundtrack,
which was originally scheduled to include several Presley tracks, the A-Teens
picking it for inclusion in the soundtrack. It was later also featured as a
bonus track on their third studio album, _[New Arrival](/wiki/New_Arrival "New
Arrival")_ for the European market. The video had thus tremendous exposure on
several television channels, with the A-Teens eventually including the song in
their third album. As a result, the song had two music videos, one to promote
the Disney movie, the other for the album. It is also shown in the teen pop
compilation album, _[Disney Girlz Rock](/wiki/Disney_Girlz_Rock "Disney Girlz
Rock")_.

The song did not chart in the United States but reached No. 12 in
[Sweden](/wiki/Sweden "Sweden"), No. 16 in [Argentina](/wiki/Argentina
"Argentina"), and No. 41 in [Australia](/wiki/Australia "Australia"). Despite
the success of the song overseas, it failed to attract the rest of the [Latin
American](/wiki/Latin_American "Latin American") public, due to the fact that
there was a [Spanish](/wiki/Spanish_language "Spanish language") version of
the song, performed by the [Argentine](/wiki/Argentina "Argentina") group,
[Bandana](/wiki/Bandana_\(pop_group\) "Bandana \(pop group\)"). In addition,
the A-Teens' version of the song was overshadowed by the promotion of
Bandana's version.

### Music
video[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Can%27t_Help_Falling_in_Love&action=edit&section=13
"Edit section: Music video")]

The video was directed by [Gregory Dark](/wiki/Gregory_Dark "Gregory Dark")
and filmed in [Los Angeles](/wiki/Los_Angeles "Los Angeles"),
[California](/wiki/California "California"). It had two different versions.
The "Disney Version", as the fans named it, features scenes of the movie, and
also new scenes of the A-Teens with beach costumes. The "A-Teens Version" of
the video, features the A-Teens on the white background with different close-
ups and choreography, and scenes with puppies and different costumes.

### Other artists who recorded the
song[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Can%27t_Help_Falling_in_Love&action=edit&section=16
"Edit section: Other artists who recorded the song")]

  * [Erasure](/wiki/Erasure "Erasure") released a cover of this song on their 2003 album [Other People's Songs](/wiki/Other_People%27s_Songs "Other People's Songs").
  * [Keely Smith](/wiki/Keely_Smith "Keely Smith"), whose cover was on the charts at the same time as Presley's.
  * The uptempo version by [Andy Williams](/wiki/Andy_Williams "Andy Williams") peaked at No. 3 in the [UK Singles Chart](/wiki/UK_Singles_Chart "UK Singles Chart") in March 1970.
  * The [Al Martino](/wiki/Al_Martino "Al Martino") recording was released by [Capitol Records](/wiki/Capitol_Records "Capitol Records") as catalog number 2746 and charted in 1970, peaking at No. 51 on the _[Billboard](/wiki/Billboard_\(magazine\) "Billboard \(magazine\)")_ charts and No. 57 on the _[Cashbox](/wiki/Cashbox_\(magazine\) "Cashbox \(magazine\)")_ chart.
  * [Filipina](/wiki/Filipino_people "Filipino people") singer-actress [Nora Aunor](/wiki/Nora_Aunor "Nora Aunor"), released this single 1971 and is part of her [_Blue Hawaii_](/wiki/Blue_Hawaii_\(Nora_Aunor_album\) "Blue Hawaii \(Nora Aunor album\)") album.
  * [Taiwanese](/wiki/Taiwan "Taiwan") boyband [F4](/wiki/F4_\(band\) "F4 \(band\)") covered the song in Mandarin version for their album [Fantasy 4ever](/wiki/Fantasy_4ever "Fantasy 4ever") which was released in December 2002.
  * [William Control](/wiki/William_Control "William Control") released this single in 2010 inside his second album _Noir_.
  * [Bob Dylan](/wiki/Bob_Dylan "Bob Dylan") recorded a version of this song for his 1973 cover album, _[Dylan](/wiki/Dylan_\(1973_album\) "Dylan \(1973 album\)")_.
  * [The Stylistics](/wiki/The_Stylistics "The Stylistics")' disco version was a hit in the [UK](/wiki/UK_Singles_Chart "UK Singles Chart"), climbing to No. 4 in June 1976.
  * [Shirley Bassey](/wiki/Shirley_Bassey "Shirley Bassey") recorded a version of this song for a 1976 single.
  * [Neil Diamond](/wiki/Neil_Diamond "Neil Diamond") covered the song with orchestration by [Elmer Bernstein](/wiki/Elmer_Bernstein "Elmer Bernstein") for the 1998 album _[The Movie Album: As Time Goes By](/wiki/The_Movie_Album:_As_Time_Goes_By "The Movie Album: As Time Goes By")_.
  * Abbey Road Records issued a version by [Herb Reed & The Original Platters](/wiki/The_Platters "The Platters") in 1977.
  * [Lick the Tins](/wiki/Lick_the_Tins "Lick the Tins") included the song on their 1986 album _[Blind Man on a Flying Horse](/wiki/Blind_Man_on_a_Flying_Horse "Blind Man on a Flying Horse")_. It was a minor hit on the British charts, and it was featured in the ending credits of the films _[Some Kind of Wonderful](/wiki/Some_Kind_of_Wonderful_\(film\) "Some Kind of Wonderful \(film\)")_ and _[The Snapper](/wiki/The_Snapper_\(film\) "The Snapper \(film\)")_.
  * In 1987, [Corey Hart](/wiki/Corey_Hart_\(singer\) "Corey Hart \(singer\)")'s recording reached No. 1 in his native Canada and No. 24 on the _Billboard_ Hot 100. The cover and song were used with the image of forlorn animals in desperate need of rescue for a fundraising television commercial for the Ontario Humane Society.
  * [U2](/wiki/U2 "U2") used the song frequently on the [Zoo TV Tour](/wiki/Zoo_TV_Tour "Zoo TV Tour") to close the concert.
  * [Ingrid Michaelson](/wiki/Ingrid_Michaelson "Ingrid Michaelson") released an updated version on her album _[Be OK](/wiki/Be_OK_\(album\) "Be OK \(album\)")_ in 2008, which was nominated for the [American Music Award](/wiki/American_Music_Award "American Music Award") for Favorite Pop/Rock Single, and [Independent Music Award](/w/index.php?title=Independent_Music_Award&action=edit&redlink=1 "Independent Music Award \(page does not exist\)") for Best Song – Cover.
  * [Haley Reinhart](/wiki/Haley_Reinhart "Haley Reinhart")'s remake of the song was used in a 2015 advert for [Extra](/wiki/Extra_\(gum\) "Extra \(gum\)") gum and peaked at No. 17 on the _Billboard_ Adult Contemporary chart and No. 31 on the _Billboard_ Adult Pop Songs chart. It was certified Gold by the Recording Industry Association of America on February 17, 2017.
  * [Twenty One Pilots](/wiki/Twenty_One_Pilots "Twenty One Pilots")' arrangement of the song was released in 2012 as a video cover on their YouTube channel, was recorded for their _Holding On To You EP_ (UK release) in 2013, and is played live on tour.
  * Liela Avila' version of the song was used in closing credits of the 2008 film _The Other End of The Line_.
  * [Keaton Henson](/wiki/Keaton_Henson "Keaton Henson") recorded the song in his session called _Forts Pt. 2_ in the spring of 2012.
  * [Chris Isaak](/wiki/Chris_Isaak "Chris Isaak") on _[Beyond the Sun](/wiki/Beyond_the_Sun_\(album\) "Beyond the Sun \(album\)")_ (2011).
  * Eels frontman Mark Oliver Everret (stage name E), included a cover of the song on the 2008 album Useless Trinkets: B-Sides, Soundtracks, Rarities and Unreleased 1996–2006.
  * Doris Day "Love Him" album December 1963
  * Engelbert Humperdinck recorded an uptempo version for his 1979 album "This Moment In Time".
  * [Vov Dylan](/wiki/Vov_Dylan "Vov Dylan") and The Palace Orchestra recorded an instrumental version of this song for the album "So In Love" (2015)[28]
  * [Klaus Nomi](/wiki/Klaus_Nomi "Klaus Nomi")'s cover of the song was featured on the album _[Encore](/wiki/Encore_\(Klaus_Nomi_album\) "Encore \(Klaus Nomi album\)")_ , released in 1983 shortly after his death from [AIDS](/wiki/AIDS "AIDS")
  * [Daniel Padilla](/wiki/Daniel_Padilla "Daniel Padilla")'s version of the song was used as the theme song of the 2017 Philippine romantic drama film of the same name, also titled _[Can't Help Falling in Love](/wiki/Can%27t_Help_Falling_in_Love_\(film\) "Can't Help Falling in Love \(film\)")_ which is starred by him and Kathryn Bernardo.[29]
  * [Pentatonix](/wiki/Pentatonix "Pentatonix") covered the song for their 2017 extended play _[PTX, Vol. IV - Classics](/wiki/PTX,_Vol._IV_-_Classics "PTX, Vol. IV - Classics")_.
  * Beck recorded a version for the Amazon original _The Man in the High Castle_.
  * Perry Como recorded a version of this song in June 1962

"Swansea City A.F.C."). It is also used by [Scottish](/wiki/Scotland "Scotland") clubs [Dundee United](/wiki/Dundee_United "Dundee United") , [Airdrie United](/wiki/Airdrie_United "Airdrie United") and [Raith Rovers](/wiki/Raith_Rovers "Raith Rovers"), [Portland Timbers](/wiki/Portland_Timbers "Portland Timbers") and [Columbus Crew](/wiki/Columbus_Crew "Columbus Crew") of [Major League Soccer](/wiki/Major_League_Soccer "Major League Soccer"), as well as [Central Coast Mariners](/wiki/Central_Coast_Mariners "Central Coast Mariners") of [Hyundai A-League](/wiki/Hyundai_A-League "Hyundai A-League").
  * The English punk band [Leatherface](/wiki/Leatherface_\(band\) "Leatherface \(band\)") (who are from Sunderland) released a punk arrangement of the song on a limited edition 7" in 1993. This version would later be used in the final episode of _[Sons of Anarchy](/wiki/Sons_of_Anarchy "Sons of Anarchy")_.
  * The Argentine pop group [Bandana](/wiki/Bandana "Bandana") also featured a Spanish version of the song for the Spanish-speaking countries soundtrack of the same movie.
  * [Céline Dion](/wiki/C%C3%A9line_Dion "Céline Dion") performs a live rendition of the song on her 1995 DVD/VHS release _[The Colour of My Love Concert](/wiki/The_Colour_of_My_Love_Concert "The Colour of My Love Concert")_. This particular performance has been hailed as one of Dion's greatest vocal performances ever, live or recorded.[_[citation needed](/wiki/Wikipedia:Citation_needed "Wikipedia:Citation needed")_] She also performed this song at the 2002 _[Diva's Live](/wiki/VH1_Divas "VH1 Divas")_ in Las Vegas show. In August 2007, she performed the song once more during her _[A New Day...](/wiki/A_New_Day... "A New Day...")_ show.
  * [The Who](/wiki/The_Who "The Who") integrated parts of the song into their 2004 single "[Real Good Looking Boy](/wiki/Real_Good_Looking_Boy "Real Good Looking Boy")". In fact, the song is credited to [Pete Townshend](/wiki/Pete_Townshend "Pete Townshend"), [George Weiss](/wiki/George_David_Weiss "George David Weiss"), [Hugo Peretti](/wiki/Hugo_Peretti "Hugo Peretti") and [Luigi Creatore](/wiki/Luigi_Creatore "Luigi Creatore").
  * The 2004 Broadway musical _[All Shook Up](/wiki/All_Shook_Up_\(musical\) "All Shook Up \(musical\)")_ , based on [William Shakespeare](/wiki/William_Shakespeare "William Shakespeare")'s play _[Twelfth Night](/wiki/Twelfth_Night_\(play\) "Twelfth Night \(play\)")_ with songs by Elvis, has a version of the song.
  * [Keele University](/wiki/Keele_University "Keele University") hockey club in Staffordshire, UK, have adopted this song as their own, changing the "you" to "keele".
  * [Il Divo](/wiki/Il_Divo "Il Divo") cover their song in their compilation album _The Greatest Hits_.
  * Canadian reggae fusion group [Magic!](/wiki/Magic! "Magic!") (known for their debut single "[Rude](/wiki/Rude_\(song\) "Rude \(song\)")") recorded a version of this song.
  * [Christina Grimmie](/wiki/Christina_Grimmie "Christina Grimmie") performed the song during the sixth season of _[The Voice](/wiki/The_Voice_\(U.S._TV_series\) "The Voice \(U.S. TV series\)")_ in 2014.[30]
  * Actor [Patrick Wilson](/wiki/Patrick_Wilson_\(American_actor\) "Patrick Wilson \(American actor\)") impersonates Elvis by performing the song in the film _[The Conjuring 2](/wiki/The_Conjuring_2 "The Conjuring 2")_.
  * During the first track of the album [Ladies and Gentlemen We Are Floating in Space](/wiki/Ladies_and_Gentlemen_We_Are_Floating_in_Space "Ladies and Gentlemen We Are Floating in Space") by the English band [Spiritualized](/wiki/Spiritualized "Spiritualized"), the first verse of "Can't Help Falling in Love" is repeated throughout the whole song.
